title: How Many Calories Are in 1 Shrimp?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 1 shrimp, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for a medium cooked shrimp.
h1: How Many Calories Are in 1 Shrimp?
assumptions: Medium-sized shrimp (about 6 g), cooked (boiled or steamed), peeled, no added salt, butter, or sauce.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shrimp size, species, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium cooked shrimp has about 6 kcal and 1.4 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Use large shrimp (about 10 g) instead of medium

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 medium shrimp?
faqs.a: Approximately 6 kcal for one medium cooked shrimp.

faqs.q: Is shrimp high in protein per piece?
faqs.a: Yes, about 1.4 g protein per medium shrimp, low fat and carbs.

faqs.q: How does shrimp size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger shrimp have more calories; small ~4 kcal, jumbo ~15 kcal each.
Negligible carbs (0 g per medium shrimp); mostly protein.

faqs.q: What's the cholesterol in one shrimp?
faqs.a: About 10 mg per medium cooked shrimp.
